news.title: MMRDA greenlights ₹12,000 crore for major metro projects, boosting Mumbai’s urban mobility
news.para: ​To ensure smooth last-mile connectivity, MMRDA sanctioned Rs 535 crore for multi-modal integration across 32 Metro stations on Lines 4 and 4A.

news.title: JP Morgan leases office in Mumbai’s BKC in ₹1,000 crore rental deal
news.para: JP Morgan has leased over 116,210 sq ft in Sumitomo's BKC commercial tower for 10 years, potentially extending to 25. The deal, estimated at nearly ₹1,000 crore initially and exceeding ₹2,500 crore overall, marks a significant commitment in Mumbai's prime property market. This new office is expected to house JP Morgan’s India headquarters.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh cuts Ghaziabad civic body's office budget by ₹10 crore
news.para: The new office, expected to be ready next year, will be built on a 21,000sqm plot, with an additional 5,655sqm for parking, which includes GMC's fleet of official vehicles and door-to-door collection vehicles.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh government looks to implement rainwater harvesting in 2.3 lakh buildings
news.para: The conservation of water will help check groundwater depletion. Through sustained monitoring, the creation of harvesting systems was already achieved within 34,000 public buildings across Uttar Pradesh.

news.title: Unauthorised constructions cannot be claimed as an absolute right: Madras HC
news.para: A division bench of justice S M Subramaniam and justice A D Maria Clete observed that regularisation or condonation are only enabling provisions and must be granted exceptionally in deserving cases where an injustice was caused.

news.title: Five months after offence report, government fails to stop constructions in Aravalis
news.para: More than five months after the issuance of a forest offence report (FOR) as well as a show-cause notice over illegal encroachments in Aravali forest area, no meaningful action was taken by the forest department, environmentalists said on Monday.

news.title: Pimpri Chinchwad residents to intensify protest against draft of revised development plan
news.para: The residents held a protest march on Sunday to press for their demands and raised concerns regarding the alignment of the High Capacity Mass Transit Route (HCMTR). PCMC published the draft of revised DP last month, which is currently open for public suggestions and objections.

news.title: ArisInfra Solutions' shares debut with nearly 8% discount
news.para: The stock started trading at Rs 209.10, a decline of 5.81 per cent from the issue price on the BSE. Later, it dropped 9.90 per cent to Rs 200. At the NSE, it listed at Rs 205, reflecting a discount of 7.65 per cent.

news.title: Now, residents can complete land mutation online from Jaipur development body's portal
news.para: Soon, JDA will roll out the e-mutation services on its portal. "This step has been taken with property management and transparency in mind. People will get relief from the service of auto mutation through the 90A API on the e-Dharti portal," said JDA Commissioner Anandhi.

news.title: Sambhajinagar civic body razes illegal & dangerous structures
news.para: Civic teams targeted illegal structures and extensions of around 25 shops in the bustling Rangar Galli market and its surrounding areas. The operation also involved the demolition of an old dilapidated building, which was carried out with police present.

news.title: BCC shifts e-Khata applications to Belagavi One centres following corruption concerns
news.para: Previously, applications were accepted manually at three divisional BCC offices. However, after corporators raised concerns over corruption, BCC commissioner Shubha B conducted a surprise inspection.

news.title: Odisha HC asks administration to file report on unsafe buildings in Cuttack
news.para: In an order passed on June 19, the special bench hearing PILs related to civic issues directed the Cuttack administration to file a comprehensive status report on unsafe structures when the matter comes up next on Aug 14.

news.title: Cannot raze all 500 unauthorised wetland buildings, EKWA tells Kolkata HC
news.para: Counsel for the South 24 Parganas district administration urged the court to direct expert bodies like the KMC to deploy engineers for the demolition job.

news.title: Mumbai: BMC invites suggestions on new policy for 'iconic buildings'
news.para: ​The proposed policy defines "Iconic Buildings or Spaces" as structures that possess unique or distinctive characteristics such as size, shape, aesthetics, look, concept, theme, urban design, architectural design, or structural elements.

news.title: Bhopal: Unsafe and structurally unsound buildings caught in legal tangle as monsoon hangs
news.para: According to the 2023-24 assessment, authorities identified more than 1,500 such structures across Berasia Road, Budhwara, Jahangirabad, and Hamidia Road areas. Amongst these, 242 buildings were categorised as severely dangerous.

news.title: Noida: Rehabilitation fee paid, can Lotus Boulevard Espacia buyers register flats now?
news.para: The developer, Cloud 9 Projects, deposited Rs 21 crore with Noida Authority in April this year, and this amounts to 25% of its dues after accounting for relief during the Covid period.

news.title: Thane: Yogeshwar Heights' compound wall collapses in Kalyan, FIR registered against builder
news.para: The CCTV footage of the building shows that the incident happened around 1:32am on Tuesday when the residents of Yogeshwar Building heard a loud sound of something falling.

news.title: Mohali: Consumer forum orders Palm Heights to refund buyer's money
news.para: Rajput, currently posted at 3BRD Chandigarh, had booked a 3BHK flat in Palm Heights project at Derabassi back in 2015. Like many homebuyers, she dreamed of a secure future in her own home.

news.title: Karnataka minister rejects EWS housing scheme graft charges, seeks probe
news.para: The minister was responding to claims made by ruling Congress MLA from Aland, B R Patil, who alleged that bribes were being collected from poor families in exchange for houses.

news.title: Himachal Pradesh government appoints new HP RERA chairperson & member
news.para: RD. Dhiman, IAS (Retd.), has been appointed as the Chairperson of Himachal Pradesh RERA, while Amit Kashyap, IAS (Retd.), has been named as a Member of HP RERA.
